intro: Boehmeria clidemioides var. umbrosa, commonly known as the dark-leafed nettle, is a flowering plant species native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes various species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a distinctive dark green coloration. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in spikes and are typically found in the axils of the leaves. This variety is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to shaded environments.
